title: Compilation on Xeon E5-2650 computer
body:
### Problem

I am trying to compile some rust code on a relatively old computer (that is "Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2650 v2 @ 2.60GHz").
When compiling, I get the following error: **Error: no such instruction: `shrx %rsi,%rax,%rax'**.
The rust compiler was set up with **curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://sh.rustup.rs | sh
**.

I understand that the processor is now 10 years old but still, I can compile GCC on it and do plenty of useful work. So, I would appreciate it if rust supported this CPU. If that were not possible, it would be nice to have a warning beforehand about that so that the error do not show while 

### Steps

"cargo build" on some code, anything really.

### Possible Solution(s)

Two possible type of solution would be nice:
* A support by cargo of this CPU. Maye there is just some tweaks to do for LLVM as this line of CPU ought to be supported by LLVM.
* An indication that this CPU is not supported while installing cargo.

### Notes

_No response_

### Version

```text
cargo 1.60.0 (d1fd9fe 2022-03-01)
release: 1.60.0
commit-hash: d1fd9fe2c40a1a56af9132b5c92ab963ac7ae422
commit-date: 2022-03-01
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
libgit2: 1.3.0 (sys:0.13.23 vendored)
libcurl: 7.80.0-DEV (sys:0.4.51+curl-7.80.0 vendored ssl:OpenSSL/1.1.1m)
os: CentOS 6.6 (Final) [64-bit]
```
